perturbation.original_text:
7.5. Payment Terms. Each party shall provide the other party with all
amounts due under this Agreement for the prior calendar quarter within 30 days
after the end of each calendar quarter during the Term. Each payment shall be
accompanied by a statement detailing the amount of applicable gross revenue
received, the calculation of the amount due to the other party and the amount of
the payment accompanying such statement. All payments due to either party
hereunder shall be made in immediately available U.S. funds, without set-off or
counterclaim, free and clear of (and without deduction for or grossed up for, as
applicable), any taxes, duties, charges, withholdings, restrictions or
conditions of any nature imposed or levied by any governmental taxing or other
authority.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.5. Payment Terms. Each party shall provide the other party with all
amounts due under this Agreement for the prior calendar quarter within 60 days
after the end of each calendar quarter during the Term. Each payment shall be
accompanied by a statement detailing the amount of applicable gross revenue
received, the calculation of the amount due to the other party and the amount of
the payment accompanying such statement. All payments due to either party
hereunder shall be made in immediately available U.S. funds, without set-off or
counterclaim, free and clear of (and without deduction for or grossed up for, as
applicable), any taxes, duties, charges, withholdings, restrictions or
conditions of any nature imposed or levied by any governmental taxing or other
authority.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the payment term from '30 days' to '60 days' creates an in-text contradiction with Section 8.2, which states that either party may terminate the agreement 'immediately upon written notice to the other party in the event any material breach of a material term of this Agreement by such other party that remains uncured 30 days in the case of a breach of a payment obligation'. This makes it unclear whether a 30-day or 60-day period is the acceptable payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text:
7.8. Interest. All payments not paid by the date such payments are due
shall bear interest from the due date to the date payments are actually paid at
the rate of the lower of (a) 1% per month or (b) the maximum rate permitted by
law.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.8. Interest. All payments not paid by the date such payments are due
shall bear interest from the due date to the date payments are actually paid at
the rate of the lower of (a) 2% per month or (b) the maximum rate permitted by
law.
perturbation.explanation: By altering the interest rate on late payments from '1% per month' to '2% per month', the contract now faces a potential enforcement issue. This introduces uncertainty since parties might dispute which rate is valid, leading to disagreements and potential legal challenges during enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
8.1. Automatic Renewal. This Agreement will automatically renew at the end
of the Initial Term or a subsequent renewal term on a year to year basis (each,
a "Renewal Term"), unless either party notifies the other at least 30 days prior
to the end of the Initial Term or then current Renewal Term, as applicable, of
its intention not to renew this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.1. Automatic Renewal. This Agreement will automatically renew at the end
of the Initial Term or a subsequent renewal term on a year to year basis (each,
a "Renewal Term"), unless either party notifies the other at least 60 days prior
to the end of the Initial Term or then current Renewal Term, as applicable, of
its intention not to renew this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Modifying the notice period for non-renewal from '30 days' to '60 days' creates uncertainty about when such notice should be given. This discrepancy can result in disputes about whether the contract was properly renewed or terminated, potentially leading to legal challenges and enforcement difficulties.
